subject: RE: [junit] Why Outlook thinks Junit postings are spam (slightly off topic)
msgSnippet: Sorry if the conversation has moved on, but I just saw this thread and thought the following might be helpful.  Best, --Chris From the Microsoft Outlook (2000)
messageBody:
Sorry if the conversation has moved on, but I just saw this thread and
thought the following might be helpful. Best, --Chris

From the Microsoft Outlook (2000) online Help:

*** Make an exception in my Junk Senders list ***
On the Tools menu, click Rules Wizard.
In the Apply rules in the following order box, click Exception List.
In the Rule description box, click Exception List.
Click Add.
Enter the e-mail address you want to make an exception for.
The name and domain you enter will appear in your Inbox, even if you have
the domain listed in your Junk Senders list.


-----Original Message-----
From: Andrew Clarke [mailto:andrew.clarke@...]
Sent: Wednesday, January 23, 2002 6:50 AM

...

But I noticed that lots (but not all) of the Junit postings were being
routed into the spambox. When I investigated I discovered they all had
[advertising]
in common...

...
